LoN (Age of Sigmar) [4,190pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 2,000 (Death: Legions of Nagash and Nighthaunt) [4,190pts]

    Rules: Returning Slain Models - Nighthaunt

    • Uncategorised [140pts]

      • Guardian of Souls with Mortality Glass [140pts]

        Categories: DEATH, MALIGNANT, NIGHTHAUNT, HERO, WIZARD, GUARDIAN OF SOULS

        Magic: Guardian of Souls with Mortality Glass, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Temporal Translocation, Unit: Guardian of Souls, Unit Abilities: Ethereal, Fly, Mortality Glass


        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Guardian of Souls with Mortality Glass 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Temporal Translocation
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Temporal Translocation 6If successfullly cast, pick a friendly NIGHTHAUNT unit wholly within 24' of the caster. You can make a normal move of up to 6" with that unit. If that unit retreats as part of this move, it can still charge in the same turn.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Guardian of Souls 6"5104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Ethereal Ignore modifiers (positive or negative) when making save rolls for this unit.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Mortality Glass When enemy units within 9" of this model charge, roll a D6 instead of 2D6 when determining the distance they can move.

    • Leader [3,030pts]

      • Arkhan the Black, Mortarch of Sacrament [340pts]

        Categories: DEATH, SKELETON, DEATHLORDS, MONSTER, HERO, WIZARD, MORTARCH, ARKHAN, Leader, Behemoth

        Arkhan's Wounds Suffered: 0-2, 3-4, 5-6, 7-8, 9+, Command Abilities: First of the Mortarchs, Magic: Arkhan, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Curse of Years, Mystic Shield, Unit: Arkhan the Black, Mortarch of Sacrament, Unit Abilities: Deathly Invocation, Feaster of Souls, Fly, Frightful Touch, Mortarch of Sacrament, The Staff of Spirits, Weapon: Khenash-an, Razarak's Ebon Claws, Spirits' Spectral Claws and Daggers, Zefet-kar


        Arkhan's Wounds Suffered MoveEbon ClawsKhenash-an Ref

        3-4 13"5+2 cast/+1 unbind
        5-6 10"4+1 cast/+1 unbind

        9+ 4"2-
        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        First of the Mortarchs If Arkhan the Black uses this ability, then until the end of the hero phase all friendly DEATH WIZARDSwithin 18" of him can increase the range of their spells by 6.
        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Arkhan 2/2Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield and Curse of Years spells. Arkhan also knows the spells of any DEATH WIZARD that is within 18" of him.
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Curse of Years 6If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them and roll ten dice. For each roll of 6, that unit suffers a mortal wound and you can roll an extra dice. For each roll of 5+ on these extra dice, the target suffers another mortal wound and you can roll another dice. Now, for each roll of 4+, the target suffers another mortal wound and you can roll another dice. Keep rolling dice in this way, inflicting mortal wounds and reducing the roll needed to cause them by 1 each time, until either no wounds are inflicted or the target unit is destroyed.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Arkhan the Black, Mortarch of Sacrament *11104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Deathly Invocation At the start of your hero phase, pick up to 4 different friendly SUMMONABLE units within 18" of Arkhan. You can heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to each unit you picked (roll separately for each unit). If no wounds are currently allocated to a unit you picked, you may instead return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Feaster of Souls At the end of any combat phase in which Arkhan slew any models, you can heal 2 wounds that have been allocated to him.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Frightful Touch If the unmodified roll for an attack made with the <Banshee Mandmaidens' Spectral Claws>, <Wraith Herald's Spectral Claws>, <Fellreaper>, <Reaper Scythe> <Chill Dagger> <Spectral Scythe> <Cairn Wraith's Reaper Scythe> <Spectral Claws and Daggers> <Spectral Host's Ethereal Weapons>, <Mourngul's Nightmarish Claws and Fangs> is 6, that attack inflicts <the weapon damage as a> mortal wound and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).
        Mortarch of Sacrament You can re-roll any of the D3 rolls when using Arkhan’s Deathly Invocation ability.
        The Staff of Spirits “Add Khenash-an’s modifier (listed in Arkhan's Wound Table) to casting and unbinding rolls for Arkhan.

      • Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead [850pts]

        Categories: DEATH, HERO, NAGASH, PRIEST, WIZARD, DEATHLORDS, MONSTER, Leader, Behemoth

        Command Abilities: Supreme Lord of Death, Magic: Nagash, Nagash's Wounds Suffered: 00-03, 04-06, 07-10, 11-13, 14+, Spell: Hand of Dust, Soul Stealer, Unit: Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead, Unit Abilities: Death Magic Incarnate, Deathly Invocation, Fly, Frightful Touch, Morikane, The Nine Books of Nagash, The Staff of Power, Weapon: Alakanash, Gaze of Nagash, Spirits' Spectral Claws and Daggers, Zeft-nebtar


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Supreme Lord of Death If Nagash uses this ability, then until your next hero phase you can re-roll hit and save rolls of 1 for all friendly DEATH units. In addition, do not take battleshock tests for DEATH units affected by this ability.
        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Nagash 3/3 *Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, Hand of Dust and Soul Stealer spells, as well as any spells known by other DEATH WIZARDS on the battlefield
        Nagash's Wounds Suffered The Nine Books of NagashZefet-nebtarAlakanash Ref
        00-03 Cast and unbind 5 extra spells63+ cast / 3+ unbind
        04-06 Cast and unbind 4 extra spells5+3 cast / +2 unbind
        07-10 Cast and unbind 3 extra spells4+2 cast / +2 unbind
        11-13 Cast and unbind 2 extra spells3+2 cast / +1 unbind
        14+ Cast and unbind 1 extra spell2+1 cast / +1 unbind
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Hand of Dust 8If successfully cast, pick an enemy model within 3" the caster. Then, take a dice and hide it in one of your hands. Your opponent must pick one of your hands. If they pick the one holding the dice, the spell has no effect. If they pick the empty hand, the enemy model is slain.
        Soul Stealer 6If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 24" of the caster that is visible to them and roll two dice. If the total is greater than that unit’s Bravery characteristic, it suffers D3 mortal wounds. If the total is at least double the unit’s Bravery, it suffers D6 mortal wounds instead. For each mortal wound inflicted on the target, heal 1 wound that has been allocated to the caster.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead 9"16103+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Death Magic Incarnate You can re-roll any of the D3 rolls when using Nagash’s Deathly Invocation ability (above).
        Deathly Invocation At the start of your hero phase, pick up to 5 different friendly SUMMONABLE units on the battlefield. You can heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to each unit you picked (roll separately for each unit). If no wounds are currently allocated to a unit you picked, you may instead return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Frightful Touch If the unmodified roll for an attack made with the <Banshee Mandmaidens' Spectral Claws>, <Wraith Herald's Spectral Claws>, <Fellreaper>, <Reaper Scythe> <Chill Dagger> <Spectral Scythe> <Cairn Wraith's Reaper Scythe> <Spectral Claws and Daggers> <Spectral Host's Ethereal Weapons>, <Mourngul's Nightmarish Claws and Fangs> is 6, that attack inflicts <the weapon damage as a> mortal wound and the attack sequence ends (do not make a wound or save roll).
        Morikane Each time a mortal wound is allocated to Nagash, roll a dice. On a 4+ the mortal wound is negated. On a 6+ the attacking unit also suffers a mortal wound.
        The Nine Books of Nagash The Nine Books of Nagash allow him to cast extra spells in your hero phase, and unbind extra spells in the enemy hero phase. The number of extra spells he can attempt to cast or unbind is shown on the damage table above.
        The Staff of Power Add Alakanash’s modifier (listed in the damage table) to casting and unbinding rolls for Nagash.

        Fist of Nagash If Prince Vhordrai uses this ability, pick a friendly DEATH HEROwithin 14" of him (you cannot choose Prince Vhordrai). That hero can immediately either be chosen to pile in and attack as if it were the combat phase, or if it is a WIZARD, attempt to cast a spell in addition to any others they can attempt to cast this phase. The same unit cannot be picked to benefit from this command ability more than once per hero phase. *ERRATA Jun'18*

        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        DOOM WOLF The leader of this unit is a Doom Wolf. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of a Doom Wolf’s Rotting Fangs and Claws.
        Slavering Charge Add 1 to wound rolls for this unit if it completed a charge move this turn.
        Vigour Necris Add 1 to save rolls for this unit if it is within 9" of any friendly CORPSE CARTS.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Rotting Fangs and Claws Melee1"24+4+-1 Legions of Nagash p119

    • Other [80pts]

      • Fell Bats [80pts]

        Unit: Fell Bats, Unit Abilities: Fly, Scent of Gore, Weapon: Elongated Fangs


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Fell Bats 14"3106+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Scent of Gore If an enemy model is slain within 6" of this unit, increase the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s Elongated Fangs to 6 for the rest of the battle.

    • Battalion [450pts]

      • Battalion: *COURT OF NULAHMIA [150pts]

        Categories: LEGION OF BLOOD, Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: The Adevore, The Scent of Blood


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        The Adevore Whilst she is within 9" of this battalion’s Bloodseeker Palanquin, you may re-roll failed hit rolls for Neferata if the target is an enemy HERO
        The Scent of Blood At the start of your movement phase, units from the Court of Nulahmia that are within 9" of the battalion’s Bloodseeker Palanquin may add 4" to their Move characteristic until the end of the phase.

      • Battalion: *THE FIRST COHORT [160pts]

        Categories: GRAND HOST OF NAGASH, Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: Ceaseless Vigil, Eternal Servitude


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Ceaseless Vigil Before you allocate a wound or mortal wound to Nagash, you can pick a friendly Morghast unit from this battalion within 3" of Nagash and roll a dice. On a 3+ the wound or mortal wound is allocated to that unit instead. *ERRATA Jun'18*
        Eternal Servitude If Nagash uses his Deathly Invocation ability on any SUMMONABLE unit from the First Cohort, you can treat the D3 result as 3 instead of rolling the dice.

      • Battalion: Shrieker Host [140pts]

        Categories: DEATH, Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: Mournful Wailing


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Mournful Wailing Re-roll battleshock rolls of 1 for enemy units that are within 6" of any units from this battalion at the start of the battleshock phase. In addition, the Inspiring Presence command ability cannot be used on enemy units that are within 6" of any units from this battalion.

    • Allegiance

      • Alliegiance

        Selections: Allegiance: Grand Host of Nagash

        Categories: Allegiance

        Battle Trait: Chosen Guardians, Deathless Minions, Gravesite: Invigorating Aura, Legions Innumerable, Magic, The Unquiet Dead


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Chosen Guardians Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of all melee weapons used by GRAND HOST OF NAGASH MORGHAST units.
        Deathless Minions Roll a dice each time you allocate a wound or mortal wound to a friendly DEATH unit within 6" of your general or another friendly DEATH HERO. On a 6+ the wound is negated.
        Gravesite: Invigorating Aura At the start of your hero phase, pick a friendly SUMMONABLE unit within 9" of this gravesite. You can either heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to it or, if no wounds are currently allocated to the unit, you may return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Legions Innumerable In your hero phase, you may roll a dice for each friendly GRAND HOST OF NAGASH SUMMONABLE unit on the battlefield. On a 5+ you can heal up to D3 wounds that have been allocated to it. For units with a Wounds characteristic of 1, return 1 slain model to the unit for each wound that would have been healed.
        Magic All WIZARDS in a GRAND HOST OF NAGASH army know an additional spell from one of the Lores of the Dead. If Nagash is included in the army, he instead knows an additional 3 spells from the Lores of the Dead.
        The Unquiet Dead After territories have been determined, but before any units have been set up, you may pick up to 2 points in your territory and up to 2 points anywhere on the battlefield to be gravesites. You may wish to place suitable markers on these points. Instead of setting up a SUMMONABLE unit on the battlefield, you can place it to one side and say that it is set up in the grave. You can do this with as many units as you wish. At the end of your movement phase, for each friendly Death Hero within 9" of a gravesite, you may pick a single friendly unit in the grave and set it up wholly within 9" of the gravesite and more than 9" from any enemy models. Any model that is unable to be set up in this way is slain. If a unit is still in the grave at the end of the battle, it is considered to be slain. *ERRATA Jun'18*

      • Alliegiance

        Selections: Allegiance: Grand Host of Nagash

        Categories: Allegiance

        Battle Trait: Chosen Guardians, Deathless Minions, Gravesite: Invigorating Aura, Legions Innumerable, Magic, The Unquiet Dead


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref

    • Game Options

      • Game Type

        Selections: 2000 Points - Battlehost

        Categories: Game Options, Battlehost

    • Malign Sorcery [120pts]

      • Endless Spell: Chronomatic Cogs [80pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, AZYR, CHRONOMANTIC COGS, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Chronomatic Cogs, Unit Abilities: Mechanisms of Time


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Chronomatic Cogs 7If successfully cast, set up a Chronomantic Cogs model wholly within 12" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Mechanisms of Time In their controlling player’s hero phase, a single Wizard within 9" of this model may manipulate the cogs to increase or decrease the flow of time. They may do this in the same phase as the Chronomantic Cogs are set up. If they do so, choose one of the effects opposite. The effect lasts until their next hero phase, or until an enemy Wizard chooses to manipulate the cogs. Speed Up Time: Add 2" to the Move characteristic of all units on the battlefield. In addition, add 2 to charge rolls for all units on the battlefield. Slow Down Time: The wizard manipulating the cogs can cast 1 additional spell in this hero phase. In addition, re-roll failed save rolls for that wizard.

      • Endless Spell: Shards of Valagharr [40pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, SHYISH, SHARDS OF VALAGHARR, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Shards of Valagharr, Unit Abilities: Empowered by Shyish, Ensnaring Soul-drain, Twilight Translocation


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Shards of Valagharr 5If successfully cast, set up the first Shards of Valagharr model wholly within 6" of the caster, and then set up the second Shards of Valagharr model wholly within 12" of the first.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Empowered by Shyish If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Death, the first Shards of Valagharr model can be set up wholly within 12" of the caster, instead of 6".
        Ensnaring Soul-drain At the start of the movement phase, draw an imaginary straight line 1mm wide between the closest parts of the bases of the two Shards of Valagharr models from this endless spell. Each unit passed across by this line is ensnared until the end of that turn. Halve the Move characteristic of a unit that is ensnared. In addition, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by units that are ensnared.
        Twilight Translocation At the start of the battle round, after determining who has the first turn, the players must roll off. The winner can remove one Shards of Valagharr model from this endless spell from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 12" of the other Shards of Valagharr model from this endless spell.

    • Command Points

      • Purchased Command Points

        Categories: Command Points

Force Rules

Returning Slain Models - Nighthaunt: Several Nighthaunt abilities allow you to return slain models to a unit. When you do so, set up the models one at a time within 1" of a model from the unit they are returning to (this can be a model you returned to the unit earlier in the same phase).

The slain models you return to a unit can only be set up withi 3" of an enemy unit if one or more models from the unit they are returning to are already within 3" of an enemy unit. (Battletome: Nighthaunt)
